item.title: Jennifer add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "since the thing perhaps is to eat flowers and not to be afraid" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "We can never be born enough." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "Now the ears of my ears are awake and now the eyes of my eyes are opened." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by ee cummings
item.description: "She may be going to Hell, of course, but at least she isn't standing still" -- ee cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "I will take the sun in my mouth and leap into the ripe air." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "may I be I is the only prayer--not may I be great or good or beautiful or wise or strong." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "No matter how much you think you love somebody, you'll step back when the pool of their blood edges up too close." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Nothing of me is original. I am the combined effort of everyone I've ever known." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "More and more, it feels like I'm doing a really bad impersonation of myself." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "People used what they called a telephone because they hated being close together and they were too scared of being alone." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Chuck Palahniuk
item.description: "Most of the laugh tracks on television were recorded in the early 1950’s. These days, most of the people you hear laughing are dead." -- Chuck Palahniuk

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The temptation is to stay inside; to subside into the kind of recluse whom neighborhood children regard with derision and little awe; to let the hedges and weeds grow up, to allow the doors to rust shut, to lie on my bed in some gown-shaped garment and let my hair lengthens and spread out over the pillow and my fingernails to sprout into claws, while candle wax drips onto the carpet. But long ago I made a choice between classicism and romanticism. I prefer to be upright and contained—an urn in daylight." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Bret Easton Ellis
item.description: "I have to return some videotapes" -- Bret Easton Ellis

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Bret Easton Ellis
item.description: "...there is an idea of a Patrick Bateman, some kind of abstraction, but there is no real me, only an entity, something illusory, and though I can hide my cold gaze and you can shake my hand and feel flesh gripping yours and maybe you can even sense our lifestyles are probably comparable: I simply am not there." -- Bret Easton Ellis

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want. I can never train myself in all the skills I want. And why do I want? I want to live and feel all the shades, tones and variations of mental and physical experience possible in life. And I am horribly limited." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Is there no way out of the mind?" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "The trouble was, I had been inadequate all along, I simply hadn't thought about it." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "What is my life for and what am I going to do with it? I don't know and I'm afraid. I can never read all the books I want; I can never be all the people I want and live all the lives I want." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Why do we electrocute men for murdering an individual and then pin a purple heart on them for mass slaughter of someone arbitrarily labeled “enemy?" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Out of the ash I rise with my red hair and I eat men like air." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description:
"What is it that you contain? The dead. Time. Light patterns of millennia opening in your gut. Every minute, in each of you, a few million potassium atoms succumb to radioactive decay. The energy that powers these tiny atomic events has been locked inside potassium atoms ever since a star-sized bomb exploded nothing into being. Potassium, like uranium and radium, is a long-lived radioactive nuclear waste of the supernova bang that accounts for you.
Your first parent was a star." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "When I was 5 years old, my mother always told me that happiness was the key to life. When I went to school, they asked me what I wanted to be when I grew up. I wrote down ‘happy’. They told me I didn’t understand the assignment, and I told them they didn’t understand life." -- John Lennon

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "There are no beautiful surfaces without a terrible depth." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "A thought, even a possibility, can shatter and transform us." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams
